meanings.definition: To be more than a match for; surpass in ability or strength.
meanings.sent1: The champion boxer easily overmatches his opponent in every round.
meanings.sent2: The team's hard work and dedication overmatches their competitors on the field.
meanings.sent3: The tiny ant overmatches the big grasshopper in a strength competition.
meanings.sent4: Her intelligence overmatches her lack of experience in solving complex problems.
meanings.sent5: The sun's brightness overmatches the dim light of the moon in the night sky.

meanings.definition: To be too much for; overwhelm.
meanings.sent1: The amount of work on his desk overmatches his ability to finish it all in one day.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise from the construction site overmatches the peaceful atmosphere of the park.
meanings.sent3: The delicious smell of freshly baked cookies overmatches my willpower to stick to my diet.
meanings.sent4: The excitement of the crowd overmatches the capacity of the small venue.
meanings.sent5: The strong waves overmatches the small boat, causing it to capsize.
